relation: vs. The College of New Jersey (TCNJ)
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {18587=2014 Appeared in 17 contest as the Beacons number two pitcher … Started 14 games, while throwing 78 innings … Finished the season 3-10 with a 4.31 earned run average … Racked up six complete games … Struck out 27 strike outs, while issuing just 14 walks on the season … Registered a .900 fielding percentage with five put outs and 13 assists … Appeared in seven games at the plate … Finished the year 2-for-16 at the dish with one run and two RBI … Stole one base on one attempt … Opened the season with one of her strongest performances on March 15 as she allowed just nine hits and two unearned runs over seven innings in a 3-2 win over TCNJ …  Helped UMass Boston earn their first ever win over a nationally ranked opponent by allowing five runs, four earned in a 7-5 win over #25 Wheaton College on April 1 … Allowed just two unearned runs and eight hits on April 9 in a 3-2 win over Salve Regina … Finished with one hit and an RBI April 21 at Curry College., 19794=2013 Enjoyed one of the strongest freshman campaigns of any pitcher in UMass Boston history … Finished the season 8-13 in 23 appearances … Totaled the fifth-most complete games in school history with 21 complete games in 21 starts … Recorded the third lowest single-season earned run average in school history at 3.03 … Finished the year with the second-most innings in school history with 138.2 … Registered 40 strikeouts and 34 walks … Held opponents to a .316 batting average and 40 extra-base hits … Made seven appearances at the plate, including six starts … Finished the season 4-for-16 at the plate with one run and one RBI … Recorded her first career hit in her first career plate appearance, with a pinch-hit single March 16 against Thomas College … Picked up her first career victory March 16 against Bates College, by allowing two unearned runs over seven innings in a 6-2 victory … Registered her first career multi-hit game March 20 by going 2-for-4 in a loss to Benedictine University (Ill.) … Pitched her first career shutout April 11 with a seven inning, seven hit blanking of Framingham State University … Struck out a career-high four batters, while allowing one run in a 6-1 win over Southern Maine April 24 … Helped the Beacons clinch their record third-straight trip into the Little East Conference Tournament with an eight-hit shutout of Rhode Island College on the final day of the regular season (April 27) … Allowed just six hits and two runs against Rhode Island College in her postseason debut with the Beacons on May 2., 21379=PERSONAL/ HIGH SCHOOL Graduated from New Bedford High School in 2012 … Earned two varsity letters in softball … Led her team to a Big Three Championship in Softball … A member of the National Honor Society … Born on January 5, 1994 … Daughter of Kristen and Gilbert Gray … Has two siblings, Charles and Lillian … Currently majoring in Nursing. }
